subject: Investing
title: Dollar-Cost Averaging Into Crypto
description: A micro-lesson that makes Dollar-Cost Averaging Into Crypto usable.

hook.text: An investor put $100 into Bitcoin every week for four years. She outperformed 80% of lump-sum buyers.

buildup.text: Dollar-cost averaging means investing a fixed amount at regular intervals regardless of the current price.

discovery.text: In volatile markets, DCA buys more units when prices are low and fewer when prices are high‚Äîautomatically.

twist.text: DCA doesn't guarantee profits, but it removes the impossible task of timing crypto's wild swings.

climax.text: Set up automatic weekly purchases, and volatility becomes your ally instead of your enemy.

punchline.text: You can't time the crypto market. But you can time your discipline.

quiz.question: How does DCA benefit investors in volatile crypto markets?
options: It always buys at the lowest price
It buys more units when prices are low and fewer when high
